page.title: 06Meriden-Employment.
page.content:
Meriden has not escaped in 1985 from the national problem of unemployment, but in this largely rural, green belt area, the problem is not as severe as in the urban areas nearby.
The unemployment rate in this area is 9.2%, which compares with a national rate of 13.5%.
Employment falls into two categories, those who work on the land, in local industries or in local services, and those who commute to work in the large urban areas nearby. The division between the two is roughly half and half of the local population.
